Package ray.renderer

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Renderer
    A Renderer is an object that can compute the radiance of a ray.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AmbientOcclusion
    A renderer approximating how bright light should be shining on surfaces
    BRDFIlluminator
    This class computes direct illumination using Monte Carlo integration with importance sampling according to the BRDF.
    BruteForcePathTracer
    A renderer that computes radiance recursively.
    DirectIlluminator
    The base class for all illuminators
    DirectOnlyMediumRenderer
    A volumetric renderer that computes radiance due to emitted and directly reflected light only.
    DirectOnlyRenderer
    A renderer that computes radiance due to emitted and directly reflected light only.
    KajiyaMediumPathTracer
    A volumetric renderer combining medium scatter and Kajiya-stype path tracer
    KajiyaPathTracer
    Kajiya-style recursive path tracer.
    LuminairesIlluminator
    This class computes direct illumination by integrating over the area of the luminaires.
    MIPathTracer
    A Kajiya-style path tracer with direct lighting sampling both according to the light source and the brdf function.
    MultipleIlluminator
    This class computes direct illumination using a combination of the strategies used by BRDFIlluminator and LuminairesIlluminator.
    PathTracer
    The base class for all path tracers
    PhongShader
    A simple renderer used to debug the scene.
    ProjSolidAngleIlluminator
    This class computes direct illumination at a surface by the simplest possible approach: it estimates the integral of incident direct radiance using Monte Carlo integration with a uniform sampling distribution.
